comments.value:
Hi,

We need to build a page on the London 2012 website on which to host a number of BSL videos that will explain different elements of the ticket application and purchasing process.  To the best of my knowledge we only have BSL within the volunteering section of the website, and this opens in a lightbox-like player.  Would it be possible within the CMS to build a page hosting a number of these videos, or will some customisation be required?  (You'll have to excuse my ignorance.)

I imagine the page will be hidden (i.e. not appear on any navigation) and will have link to the BSL videos, which short descriptive captions, down the main centre part of the page.

Regards,
Andy

Andy Watkins
New Media Project Manager
New Media, Communications and Public Affairs
Direct line:  +44 (0)203 2012 736

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)203 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0)207 7191 308
london2012.comhttp://www.london2012.com/

P Please consider the environment before printing this email
We do still have unresolved issues with the way this works in the volunteering section, but we will look at this and get back to you. Marked as high.
It's possible we might not need a lightbox for these videos. Instead they might be embedded straight in the page. Andy, is this correct?

Danny,

I guess if they were large enough that would be ok. However, I’m not sure what the rationale for using the light box last time was so I think I should leave it to Morag to comment. How do I add her to the ticket distribution list - will including her above do it?

Thanks,
Andy
Morag added to cc list
Implemented.

comments.value:
Hi,

I'm having a few issues with the map on the London 2012 website. More specifically, some of the changes I have made to events on the map are causing it to behave strangely and create duplicate events.

For example, as the screenshot below shows, there was an event in October 2010 at the Olympic Park. When this event was initially created in our system, there were errors in the text (eg. 'familly', as below).  I went into this document last week and made a few amendments. I then republished the event, but instead of just updating with my changes, it created a duplicate event. This means that, as the screenshot shows, there are now two articles for this event: one of which is the original version, which still has the spelling error (no. 1 below), and then also my corrected version from last week (no. 2 below).

I'm not really sure how to go about fixing this problem, as there is only one item in CMS which is displaying all of the information correctly. It just seems that instead of my updates overwriting the original, they have created a second version, and the incorrect original doesn't even exist.

Do you have any idea what has caused these problems, or how they can be fixed?

Thanks,

Michael



[cid:image001.png@01CBE7AD.E0636580]






Michael Thorne
Content Coordinator
Editorial Services department
Direct line:  +44 (0)20 3 2012 046

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0)20 7719 1308
london2012.comhttp://www.london2012.com/

H Michael,

When a page is expired the CMS should automatically poll Stamen with an update, they then make a callback to the CMS and should see that the page no longer exists and so expire it from the map.

I just ran this update process manually (see url at end of email) and it seems to have cleared the duplicate (expired) event.

http://www.london2012.com/map.php

Will keep an eye out to see why it wasn't picked up automatically.

For future reference (do let us know as well) but the url to update on a page (even an expired on) on the map is in this format. 
http://data.map.london2012.com/kitsite-updates.php?path=events/wenlock-at-the-olympic-park-for-the-oda-familly-day.php

Jamie

Brilliant thanks very much

Michael
Jamie says not billable.

comments.value: Files apparently making it to FTP server but not getting any further. Urgent, I think.

Hello Liz,
Danny reported a problem with images on the Getty server not making it through to the CMS.
I have investigated the problem and it appears that there are some images that don't have a "CMS Title".
This is s field that gets assigned by Getty, which our feed then reads in order to give the images a title.
The getty feed can be viewed here:
  http://gettyftp.kitsite.com/images.php
None of these images have a CMS Title assigned to them, which is why they're not appearing in the CMS.
I hope this makes sense.
Please let me know if you have any other questions.
Kieran

OK great.  So here is where my problem is - hope you can help.

Attached (CMS) shows the images in CMS with the date 03/03/2011 although if you look at the attached (MM) you can see the created date is 16/03/2011 (in Getty Media Manager) and this date is supposed to send the image to latest photos on our web page and it is not getting there (attachment - latest photo's shows the image is not there).  Currently the picture sent through doesn't appear anywhere on our website.

Thanks,
Justin

Thanks Kieran, i am just sending through a 2nd image 48713_DIVER_DPS_340x542.jpg with both dates 17th march to make sure it appears in latest photo's in the correct position.

Thanks for your help, much appreciated.
Justin

subject: Problem with Getty feed again

Can we just 'Rapiscan Systems' to the list of Tier 3 partners on http://www.london2012.com/about-us/the-people-delivering-the-games/international-and-uk-partners/index.php ?  If you guys make the change I can publish tomorrow morning.  The URL is
is www.rapiscansystems.comhttp://www.rapiscansystems.com
Marked as High.
Can we have this ASAP, please?
Upgraded to urgent. It will be done tomorrow am.
speldidum

Thanks! Can you please just let Tom know when it’s done? And Tom, could you then please just double check it and publish the page?

Thank you!
That's done and it's ready for publication. We have also upped the limit from 23 to 30, so you can easily add more in the future.

comments.value:
We have had a setback in our plans for video on the website. The IOC in their wisdom have instructed that we can't feature any videos including their (sports) footage on our website unless it is hosted on their YouTube channel and embedded in our pages.

This means that we have to be able to accommodate not only our TwoFour player but also a YouTube player in the website. I think this means only the sports pages - which are the main ones likely to have IOC footage in them.

Is it possible to advise how much work will be required to adjust the sports templates to be able to accommodate a YouTube player within the main sports body area? If it is easier just to hardcode them for now we are happy for you to add them manually rather than make this accessible through the CMS. If we could also add them to the searchable Video section that would be good - but I realise this may not be possible and is a nice-to-do rather than a must have.

Re: timings, we'd be looking to have up to six videos in the sports pages / video template by the end of this week if at all possible.... hard coding is fine.

Grateful for your thoughts!
Marking as high.

giggles :)

I though you *couldn't* use YouTube; I won't ask !

The good news is the implementation cost are likely to be modest, with the main cost being us adjusting any HTML/CSS for the player and testing/deployment, we should be able to set a metadata fields and let you paste in a YouTube url.

We'll also need to think of the best way to let you paste in the YouTube url as we don't really want you pasting in the whole block of HTML (or if you do we need to strip out the relevant ID's)

A couple of days work probably, by the time we have tested / deployed, if it's just the Sports template (in fact the Video template could easily be adjusted to fit any size player).

Jamie

Ha ha – I’m glad you can see the funny site. I did not mince my words about the IOC when I heard this ☺

Good re: implementation costs and good if we can also manage this through the CMS.

When do you think it is realistic to do the CMS bit given everything else you have on?

We will have some videos to go in later this week. I will let you know which pages they need to go into, as I’m happy for them to be hardcoded.

Thanks!

Hi Morag,

Does this look OK (only on dev at the moment and only on the sports template)
http://dev.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/olympic-sports/badminton.php

You assign the video by entering the YouTube code (ie. xnUNZs42GzY) in the meta data tab.

You can find the code in any YouTube url

* have also attached screen-shots to save you logging in.

Hi Jamie

This is great – thanks! However, please can you position the video in the template so that we can add text above it and text below it. We don’t necessarily want it to be the first thing on the page. Is that possible?

In terms of templates where we need this capacity, the sport pages are the main ones for now, plus we need to be able to have a video within a generic content page in the Games section (by 28 Feb – is that possible?).

How soon can we get the YouTube capability live (and does it need to go onto staging?)? We’d like the videos up this week if possible!

Many thanks

Morag

CC-ing Debs as I am away as of tonight.

Hi Jamie

This is great – thanks! However, please can you position the video in the template so that we can add text above it and text below it. We don’t necessarily want it to be the first thing on the page. Is that possible?

In terms of templates where we need this capacity, the sport pages are the main ones for now, plus we need to be able to have a video within a generic content page in the Games section (by 28 Feb – is that possible?).

How soon can we get the YouTube capability live (and does it need to go onto staging?)? We’d like the videos up this week if possible!

Many thanks

Morag

Have added into the Sports page for now at the bottom and added in a extra body2 field after it, but be careful what you put in / use this this extra body2 for, as discussed this morning it won't automatically make it's way into any repurposings of this page (ie. mobile version) or indeed the migration export. Think of it as a field that may well get thrown away.

Will add to:

- The normal video page - is that what you mean by 'main ones for now'  ?
- The generic content page, are you happy it appearing at the top where the photo normally goes (ie. just under the photo) ?

* we cannot 'embed' the video within the main body copy without significant extra development work and I am very loath to add an additional 'body2' field at the top which may get thrown away if this page is ever re purposed or exported.

That’s fabulous – thanks!

Main ones – video, generic content - perfect. Re: generic content, fine.

Debs will liaise with you on this while I’m away.
Can I get into the dev page somehow? Want to see how it looks if the video player is at the bottom, if we ideally wouldn’t put text below it – think it might get lost?

dev/lewis15 (at the grey browser popup box)

then(at the normal cms login)

client: new2012
user: deborah
pass: mptt

Danny, 

I jogged Morag on this today (Wed 10th) and she said she'd get back to me.

The code is on dev on the sports templates (if it hasn't been deleted!) and we're just waiting for them to decide:

- which templates it goes on sports and generic content
- where on those templates it goes (and if at the bottom does in need to be followed by a body2 box; so it can we centered in the body)

Lars can probably move it at a push (if your not using his 2012 'small fixes' afternoon already) you may even be able to move it yourself, or ask me and I can probably do it at SXSW ;-) If not wait for me to get back.

Jamie

Hmm, I hadn’t realised that the ability to embed YouTube videos is not currently available on the normal video template.

Is it possible to allow us to do this on the video template? I have an IOC YouTube video I need to embed today....

Alternatively – could it be hardcoded?

Morag

Morag,

I don't think this code has been deployed to live yet, it is waiting on the dev server.

We need to know which templates it needs to go on and where on those templates it goes.

Hello

I think Jamie said it was ready to go though? The template I’m concerned about is the Video template, and in particular this page - http://www.london2012.com/visiting/tickets/videos/greatest-tickets-on-earth.php

Could it be hard coded into this page?

Morag

Further to yesterday's roll out of the YouTube video capability to the video template, could we also plan to roll out the Sports page to feature the same functionality (as discussed in the above chain with Jamie)? We are happy with what has been prepped and that this is now ready to go live.

The Technology freeze expires on Wednesday evening - so could we look to do this before the end of the week e.g. Thurs or Friday? I will raise a Change Request to cover this. 

Thanks!
This is v. high priority. Needed for Friday morning.
see http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/visiting/tickets/videos/greatest-tickets-on-earth.php

Hey,

You can now insert Youtube videos into sports pages by adding the id to the meta tab. There also is a Texbox underneath for some content. Can you try it and let me know if it works as you expect it to?

Cheers,
Lars
Thank you, Lars – checking now!

This works beautifully, thank you.

The only thing is the player size – it seems to be letterboxing the video with a black strip above and below. Is this normal when you embed YouTube or is it due to the dimensions of the space the player is embedded in?

[cid:image001.png@01CBE58F.1909AE60]

subject: Embedding YouTube videos on sports pages
description:
We have had a setback in our plans for video on the website. The IOC in their wisdom have instructed that we can't feature any videos including their (sports) footage on our website unless it is hosted on their YouTube channel and embedded in our pages.

This means that we have to be able to accommodate not only our TwoFour player but also a YouTube player in the website. I think this means only the sports pages - which are the main ones likely to have IOC footage in them.

Is it possible to advise how much work will be required to adjust the sports templates to be able to accommodate a YouTube player within the main sports body area? If it is easier just to hardcode them for now we are happy for you to add them manually rather than make this accessible through the CMS. If we could also add them to the searchable Video section that would be good - but I realise this may not be possible and is a nice-to-do rather than a must have.

Re: timings, we'd be looking to have up to six videos in the sports pages / video template by the end of this week if at all possible.... hard coding is fine.

Grateful for your thoughts!

This one slipped through before we fixed the code and was not republished after the fix. I have just republished it and it looks fine now.

(Ah, Danny just beat me to it!)

I'm not sure how that has happened.
However I can't find any evidence of any others.
And - in fact - I think you have just "fixed" that one by republishing.
My guess is that - circa Jan 26 - there was a brief window when they /were/ being published (for some reason). I know that's probably not a very good answer, however the problem does/did appear to just be limited to that one page.
Keep me posted if you see any others (although, as I say, I have checked the webserver filesystem and there's no evidence of any others).

And if it's still not on the site 2 mins after it has cleared the queue, then please do let us know.

comments.value:
Would it be at all possible to get the details of the person who submits a blog comment in the emails that automatically get generated? Some of the comments (like this one) would be forwarded on to our enquiries team to deal with, and it would be brilliant if we could do that immediately, rather than have to find the comment and copy the details before sending.

Thanks

Deb

-----Original Message-----
From: support@kitsite.com [mailto:support@kitsite.com] 
Sent: 15 February 2011 14:46
To: Deborah Elstein; Kathryn Gilbert
Subject: New blog comment



A new comment has been posted to this blog post ( http://www.london2012.com/blog/2010/10/the-thinking-behind-olympic-games-ticket-prices.php ) has been submitted.

Click here to view/approve it: http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/comments/blog
 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A copy of the comment can be seen below:   
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Could you guide me to more detail on ticket pricing please. I like the idea of taking my family along from the West Country for £60 (minus petrol and parking of course) but I cannot see at what age my children have to be before I have to pay full price (my kids are 13 and 17 yrs old) nor can I spot what I have to do to qualify for the 'D' or £20 tickets - or if I will need binoculars. The Olympic Games schedule is great but it doesn't tell me what 'AA' down to 'D' means......?
Thank you.
Marking as high.

Done,

You should have just received a test comment email with my name / email on it? (I just deleted the comment)

This hasn't been resolved - please can you look into it? We're still not getting the name through on the email and now getting lots of comments through, connected to ticketing. 

Please could also add michael.thorne@london2012.com to the list of people getting the email alerts
OK. We will look at it as soon as we can.

Ok, this should be fixed properly now.
I have set myself (kieran) to receive the notification emails for a little while, during which time I will check that everything looks ok.
Obviously, please report any problems that I miss!
Kieran

Thanks Kieran.... seems to be ok now. As below, could you add Michael to the list too? (michael.thorne@london2012.com)

thanks

Have added Michael.
Kieran
Thank you

comments.value:
We have had the below email re: the 'apply now' button on our splash page.

Is it possible to label the button correctly and investigate why this user (who is blind, and using a screen reader) can't access the site?

If you can't see a way around this, please can you let me know - I will refer this back to McCann who created the page.

Thanks!

From: Robin Christopherson [mailto:robin.christopherson@abilitynet.org.uk]
Sent: 15 March 2011 11:20
To: Morag Reavley
Cc: Jon Gooday
Subject: Unlabelled button on splash screen

Morag

Just a quickie to say that I see they have an unlabelled 'img/button' graphical link on the splash page which I suspect is the way of dismissing this splash screen and going to the home page. Not only is it unlabelled but my browser blocks the clicking of that button (with a 'tick' sound) and doesn't let me go in to the site (I have to do Ctrl+Enter which does work).

Just thought you'd want to know.

Thanks, Robin.

Robin Christopherson
Head of Digital Inclusion
tel: 01926 465599 mob: 07876 547208 twit: @USA2DAY/@AbilityNet
high.
Lars, I think the nomenclature used in this description is a bit misleading. I think it just needs an alt attribute.

I've added an alt tag to the button. 

alt="Visit the London 2012 Ticket site"

Sounds ok?

Sounds good - thanks.

Is there anything regarding the issue with the user’s browser blocking the button – so he has to use Ctrl + Enter?

I had a brief look but could only find the ctrl + enter shortcut to be used for the auto-completion of Url's. 

The button itself is just an html link, i don't really see how this could be blocked somehow. 

Guessing: Maybe its because of the target="_blank" attached which might be stopped by the browser due to a setting for maybe blind people? I can imagine that multiple tabs could be quite confusing but to be honest this is just a guess ~
Thanks for checking! Is this update now live?
No problem, yes its live!

Hi Lars

Just checked this with our accessibility consultant – they say:

“The button is now labelled which is great – however my browser still blocks the pop-up when I click it. It doesn’t block it when I click the next link (‘Visit the London 2012 website’) which takes me in as well – so can they recode the button to be the same as the link?”

Can you review?

I just spoke to Robin and we believe this may be a browser issue, although Robin and I we’re both using Hello

Okay, more feedback:

"This is more of a usability issue and it is recommended hidden text is added to the page just above the ‘Find out more’ link, informing screen reader users that they may need to click ‘Ctrl+Enter’, as the site opens in a new window. This will also indicate that the website is screen reader friendly. The text can be hidden using CSS by absolutely positioning it. 

Also, the alt text on the button is: ‘Visit the London 2012 Ticket site’ and the text link is: ‘Visit the London 2012 website’ – These are both very similar and it is possible screen reader users may think they are the same link. It is recommended that there is a distinction between the two links by changing the message on one of them."

Please can you review this?
Could you suggest some copy?

Hidden text “Screen reader may need to click Ctrl+Enter, as the site will open in a new window.”

Button alt text – “Visit the London 2012 Ticketing site to apply for tickets”

Link text - “Enter the main London 2012 website”

Hey!

Ok I've done those changes. One thing ~ "my browser still blocks the pop-up" i think refers to the page being opened in a new tab or window ( as we added the target="_blank" to the link ) which i think is considered bad practice since a couple of years...

The Button and the Link are essentially the same. Both are <a href's>, the only difference really is the 'open in new window' functionality, which we could remove!

Lars

Thanks, Lars!

I think we leave the open in new window thing – it’s just up there for another day or so.
Okidoki :)

This looks great, thanks!

The splash page is now in place on staging. All ready to go.

(Lars, just fwding to you so you can add your time)

Danny,
Am guessing I should bill at least 1 day for this.
Prep on Monday: 2 hours.
Implementation Monday night (into Tues AM). 9-2:30 (with an hour or so's sleep!) - approx 4 hours very out-of-hours.
If out-of-hours = double-time, then it's 8 + 2 = 10 hours = (nearly) 1.5 days.

So:
Kieran: 1.5 days

Lars, do you want to add how long it took you? (or have you noted your time elsewhere?)
Lars: +0.1

subject: Ticketing splash page for Tues 1am
description:
Hello

Here is the splash page for Tues early morning.

I think it looks okay but it would be good to get it onto staging so we can test it by end of today if at all poss.

There's only one small tweak I would like to make and I don't know if you can help - I'd like the BT and Lloyds logos to open in new windows (they don't currently). Is that possible?

Thanks!

Morag

Morag Reavley
New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000

Hi Morag,
This is because the promotion of the redirects file (from staging->live) has been temporarily disabled in order to implement and test the tickets splash page for Tuesday morning.
Please let me know if this redirect is uber-urgent - we can find a way of manually adding it.
Kieran

Hi Kieran

I would like this redirect setting up asap please. It needs to be live at the very latest with the Ticketing splash page late tonight – but I’m keen to ensure that we can test it before then.

The other two short URLs we require are these:

http://www.london2012.com/journeytimes - to point to http://www.london2012.com/visiting/getting-to-the-games/journey-time-matrix/journey-time-matrix.pdf

http://www.london2012.com/ticket-website-checker - to point to the website checker when it’s live later today (don’t know what the URL will be)

Again, both are required to work by the time the Ticketing splash is up tonight. Can you advise on the best way to do this?

Morag
These

I can confirm that http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/ticketsbsl is redirecting as expected.

And this will go live simultaneously with the ticketing splash page.

You may want to add the other short URLs, too. these will also go live with the splash page.

comments.value:
Hi,
Could I have a few more changes made to the form:

-          For the Ticket info, it says, 'leave empty if free' but it's a required field.  Can we have 'Input if Free or '  (see screen grab bottom of page below)

-          In the back-end, the event is coming through tagged, 'Open Weekend 2010'  It should be 2011.

-          -Change categories: New ones are

Art, Film and Digital, Literature and Libraries, Museums and Galleries, Music, Outdoor Events, Theatre, Dance and Comedy



-          -  Can we add the following text at the top of the page under Creating your Open Weekend event

'Please complete the following registration form to register your event for Open Weekend 2011. Please remember that this information will be used to create your online event listing which the public will use to find out about your event; make it as exciting and engaging as possible.'

-          -Changes to the T's and C's text:  3rd line '...will be sent to you' add 'directly' after 'you' so it reads ...will be sent to you directly

-          - Change The following information is only for internal use to The following information is for internal use only
-When uploading image it does this after you've submitted it: Can' t see image, so don't understand what to do.

-          [cid:image002.png@01CBD745.173C63A0]








[cid:image001.png@01CBD738.D7135560]

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.comhttp://www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012http://www.twitter.com/london2012

Liz / Zara - 

We've amended the form accordingly.
This though I'm not sure I understand, can you please clarify what exactly happened?
"-When uploading image it does this after you've submitted it: Can' t see image, so don't understand what to do."

Hi Janos

When we upload an image at our end, we can’t preview what the image is.

Step one:
[cid:image001.png@01CBD801.78970080]
[ have uploaded image]

Step two- get this page and can’t see image in it. Get the little x rather than a preview of an image.
[cid:image002.png@01CBD801.78970080]
Jamie, assigning to you for now.
Handing this over to Janos, when he has confirmed availability.
(as already discussed--assigned to you)

New behaviour on the open weekend form.

1. First the user enters the event name and uploads the image (if there's such)
2. Then she fills the rest of the form.

It lets the user to actually preview the image and makes it more obvious what goes online. Also we had a small issue with some weird mime type images (which forced pictures not to appear) - this is supposed to be fixed now.


It also has a 'submit new event' button on the thank you page - it then prefills a couple of the fields (mostly about the organizer but we can change what fields to prefill).
Jamie, do you want us to charge for any of these changes?
(previous comment meant to be private)

Not for the changes to the way the image upload works (esp. as it still doesn't work in Chrome!) I think that's just part and parcel of what we promised to deliver to them in the first place within a fixed cost (which can I check we have already billed for?).

The other changes on this ticket (asked for by Zara at the start of the ticket) we should certainly charge for, as they we're late additions / changes after we had delivered the work, I think Janos spent best part of a day on them.

We should also be charging for the new additions re. adding multiple events but I think that is covered by it's own separate ticket?
Mixture of billable (new work) and non-billable (part of original brief) work on this ticket. Marked 1 day as billable (subject to review of other Open w/e tickets).
See also #2960

comments.value:
We have spotted that a lot of users are coming into london2012.com and trying to login to their account using their Ticketing credentials. This obviously doesn't work - as the two registration systems are completely separate.

We need to clarify this for users - currently the login/forgot password pages are among the most visited on our site.

I can't edit the login page - is it therefore possible to add this text right at the top of the page (above the yellow strip):

"If you are trying to login to apply for London 2012 tickets, please visit the London 2012 ticketing site [www.tickets.london2012.com] and sign into your account there. Registration for london2012.com is separate from your registration on the ticketing website. 

This is pretty urgent - please can you look at this asap?
Sure - looking at this now.
Thank you very much

Is
 https://www.london2012.com/settings//login.php?returl=/index.php
ok
?

Looking good. Could we add one more sentence after this:

‘If you wish to manage your newsletter subscriptions or comment on the London 2012 blog, please proceed to login on this site below.’

Can you also add a para return before the yellow bar to give it a bit more space?

Thank you!
Thank you for doing this! Are you able to add in the extra sentence and para return, as above?

ok done.
sorry for missing your earlier request to do this!
Kieran

subject: Update to login page
description:
We have spotted that a lot of users are coming into london2012.com and trying to login to their account using their Ticketing credentials. This obviously doesn't work - as the two registration systems are completely separate.

We need to clarify this for users - currently the login/forgot password pages are among the most visited on our site.

I can't edit the login page - is it therefore possible to add this text right at the top of the page (above the yellow strip):

"If you are trying to login to apply for London 2012 tickets, please visit the London 2012 ticketing site [www.tickets.london2012.com] and sign into your account there. Registration for london2012.com is separate from your registration on the ticketing website.

"The second and fourth bullet points have a double line": I couldn't replicate (or didn't understand) this issue.
Marking as high (because this looks like a simple fix) and it would be nice to squeeze it in next week.

Changed main.css

div#MainContent ul li { background: url('../images/presentation/bullet-content.gif') no-repeat left 0.6em; padding-left: 14px; } 

We don't know what else this will affect but i reckon we will soon find out. So lets not forget this ticket!

Lars
